intro: Hieracium pilosella subsp. impexum, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows and grassy areas. This subspecies is known for its adaptability to various soil types and its ability to thrive in disturbed habitats.
